lines: In the forest deep and green,
Where the ancient trees have been,
Whispers of the wind tell tales,
author: Anonymous
title: Forest Whispers

lines: As morning mists begin to lift.
author: Anonymous
title: Morning Light

lines: Guide us with their gentle light,
Dreams take flight on evening's wing,
Peace to every heart they bring.
author: Anonymous
title: Starlit Peace

lines: Autumn leaves fall soft and slow,
Teaching us to let things go,
author: Anonymous
title: Autumn Wisdom

lines: Time and water shape the land,
author: Anonymous
title: River's Wisdom

lines: Standing tall through wind and rain,
Strength is found through joy and pain.
author: Anonymous
title: Mountain Strength

lines: Washing away the fears of night,
Each new day brings hope anew,
author: Anonymous
title: Dawn's Promise

lines: With nothing left to win or lose,
author: Anonymous
title: Wild Beauty

lines: As earth receives the healing rains,
Shows us who we're meant to be.
author: Anonymous
title: Thunder's Voice

lines: Where no words make a sound,
author: Anonymous
title: Silent Truth

lines: To what we're meant to be,
The peace we seek in mind.
author: Anonymous
title: Simple Moments

lines: All we've lost and might have been.
author: Anonymous
title: Stillness Power

lines: Shows the way that peace is meant.
author: Anonymous
title: Empty Path

lines: Ebb and flow of life's great dance,
Teaching us to take our chance.
author: Anonymous
title: Tidal Wisdom

lines: Reminding us to let things go.
author: Anonymous
title: Seashell Gifts

lines: Two roads diverged in yellow wood,
And sorry I could not travel both,
I took the one less traveled by,
And that has made all the difference.
author: Robert Frost
title: The Road Not Taken (excerpt)

lines: I wandered lonely as a cloud,
That floats on high o'er vales and hills,
When all at once I saw a crowd,
author: William Wordsworth
title: Daffodils (excerpt)

lines: The woods are lovely, dark and deep,
But I have promises to keep,
And miles to go before I sleep,
And miles to go before I sleep.
author: Robert Frost
title: Stopping by Woods (excerpt)

lines: but I’ve seen men walk away
and the passions of their lives,
to cry without turning their faces,
to write sonnets on sticky notes,
author: snowball0101
title: Want

lines: We’ve started over, no big deals today,
every day different from the last;
And um,,,, do you think I’d still be on here if it wasn’t for your ass…?
You are who I look for when my hand needs a squeeze. Without but within, think this thought often.
Your existence is enough. How could I not have faith in anything that feels this good.
I can feel your heart? Or at least I think I can.,,, wish I knew what to do.
Not every day you can meet someone who can call your bluff? Well not every day for me that is;
It’s fascinating and terrifying all at once. Can’t seem to get enough either. But time takes time and I have a feeling if we do see each other then we’ll know where to go from there.,  we’ll say;
author: Spiritual-Promise-26
title: You make me smile

lines: And you want her to be more
author: Desperate-Lemon-7985
title: Wednesday

lines: Freud would have loved this one! (Oedipus much?)
Can a poem also be a joke and vice versa? —See Exhibit A above!
I Am Flying Into Myself: Selected Poems 1960-2014
author: perrolazarillo
title: [poem] “Dear Advice Columnist” — Bill Knott

lines: In you,  I find myself whole.
author: bekdawg10
title: Loved

author: Desperate-Lemon-7985
title: Wednesday

lines: How can you go through life without purpose
Walk an endless path losing focus
Wondering when yours will spread their wings
But what are my dreams anyway?
What if I never build my own way
How can I wish upon the stars
When the sky seems so high and so far
They’re waiting for my moment to come
But how can I tell them that I’m already done
my story ended before it even began
The day I lost hope, tucked my tail and ran
author: velaris_78
title: Lost dreams

author: AI in style of William Wordsworth
title: Nature Reflections
